data.chText: （尤指针对政府的）反抗，违抗；起义；叛乱
data.enText: a protest against authority, especially that of a government, often involving violence; the action of protesting against authority

data.chText: 1381年的农民起义
data.enText: the Peasants' Revolt of 1381

data.chText: 领导 / 发动起义
data.enText: to lead/stage a revolt

data.chText: 军队很快镇压了叛乱。
data.enText: The army quickly crushed the revolt.

data.chText: 本届政府所遭遇到的规模最大的一次普通下院议员的反抗
data.enText: the biggest back-bench revolt this government has ever seen

data.chText: 和谈的努力最后以武装叛乱告终。
data.enText: Attempts to negotiate peace ended in armed revolt.

data.chText: 人民奋起反抗。
data.enText: The people rose in revolt .

data.chText: 反抗，反叛（当权者）
data.enText: to take violent action against the people in power

data.chText: 人民最终起来反抗军事独裁。
data.enText: Finally the people revolted against the military dictatorship.

data.chText: 农民威胁说要造反。
data.enText: The peasants threatened to revolt.

data.chText: 叛逆；违抗
data.enText: to behave in a way that is the opposite of what sb expects of you, especially in protest

data.chText: 青少年常常不遵从父母的条条框框。
data.enText: Teenagers often revolt against parental discipline.

data.chText: 使惊骇；令人厌恶
data.enText: to make you feel horror or disgust

data.chText: 电影里的各种暴力场面令我非常震惊。
data.enText: All the violence in the movie revolted me.

data.chText: 他吃饭的样子让我感到恶心。
data.enText: The way he ate his food revolted me.

data.text: shock ♦ appal ♦ horrify ♦ disgust ♦ sicken ♦ repel ♦ revolt

data.chText: 以上各词均含使人震惊、惊愕之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to surprise and upset sb very much.
shock

data.chText: 指使震惊、使惊愕：
data.enText: [often passive] to surprise sb, usually in a way that upsets them

data.chText: 听到他的死讯，我们都感到震惊。
data.enText: We were all shocked at the news of his death.
appal

data.chText: 指使大为震惊、使惊骇：
data.enText: to shock and upset sb very much

data.chText: 罪行之残暴使公众大为震惊。
data.enText: The brutality of the crime has appalled the public.
horrify

data.chText: 指使惊吓、使惊恐、恐吓：
data.enText: to make sb feel extremely shocked, upset or frightened

data.chText: 全国都对这些凶杀案感到大为震惊。
data.enText: The whole country was horrified by the killings.
disgust

data.chText: 指使作呕、使厌恶、使反感：
data.enText: to make sb feel shocked and almost ill because sth is so unpleasant

data.chText: 影片中的暴力程度实在让我反感。
data.enText: The level of violence in the movie really disgusted me.
sicken

data.chText: 指使大为震惊、使愤怒、使作呕：
data.enText: ( BrE ) to make sb feel very shocked, angry and almost ill because sth is so unpleasant

data.chText: 公众看到这些充满暴力和死亡的画面大为震惊。
data.enText: The public is becoming sickened by these images of violence and death.
repel

data.chText: 指使恶心、使厌恶：
data.enText: [often passive] ( rather formal ) to make sb feel rather disgusted

data.chText: 他呼吸中的酒精气味让我恶心。
data.enText: I was repelled by the smell of drink on his breath.
revolt

data.chText: 指使恶心、使厌恶：
data.enText: to make sb feel disgusted

data.chText: 电影里的各种暴力场面令我非常反感。
data.enText: All the violence in the movie revolted me.

data.chText: 用disgust、repel还是revolt？
disgust和revolt语气较repel强烈，尤其因道德而非身体方面的原因；对某人的观点或个人品质感到厌恶可用repel，但如果这些观点或品质变成行动，用repel语气就不够强烈：
data.enText: Disgust and revolt are stronger than repel , especially when the reason is moral, not physical. You might be repelled by sb's opinions or personal qualities, but if these opinions or qualities lead to action, repel may not be strong enough.
Violence repels me.
disgust, repel or revolt?
shocked/appalled/horrified/disgusted/sickened/repelled/revolted by sb/sth
shocked/appalled/horrified/disgusted at sb/sth
to shock/appal/horrify/disgust sb that…
to shock/appal/horrify/disgust/sicken sb to think/see/hear…
to be/feel shocked/appalled/horrified/disgusted/sickened/repelled/revolted
sb's behaviour shocks/appals/horrifies/disgusts sb
a scandal shocks sb
a smell disgusts/sickens/repels/revolts sb
really shocked/appalled/horrified/disgusted/sickened/repelled/revolted
deeply shocked/appalled/horrified/disgusted

simple_means.memory_skill: re 相反；反对；不 + volt 转 → 反转过来〔对抗自己人〕→ 反叛

ex.chText: 上星期政府镇压了一次武装叛乱。
ex.enText: The government put down an armed rebellion last week.

ex.chText: 谁在幕后策划了反对该军事政权的暴动？
ex.enText: Who was behind the rebellion against the military regime?

synonyms.bx: 指以推翻政府或统治者为目的的有组织的武装反叛。

ex.chText: 该事件标志着殖民地人民的反抗行动获得成功。
ex.enText: This event marked the successful revolt/rebellion of the colonies.

ex.chText: 那场叛乱是何时被镇压的？

synonyms.bx: 多指针对政府的武装斗争，涉及范围较小，可与 rebellion 换用。

ex.chText: 他的死亡引发了一场严重的监狱暴乱。
ex.enText: His death triggered a vicious prison riot.

ex.chText: 要采取有效措施避免难民营中发生争抢食物的骚乱。
ex.enText: Effective measures should be taken to avoid food riots in the refugee camp.

synonyms.bx: 尤指一群人为抗议某事而引发的骚乱。

ex.chText: 这一章大致介绍了南昌起义。
ex.enText: This chapter gives a general introduction to the Nanchang Uprising.

ex.chText: 最近这次平民暴动是由一位农民的儿子领导的。
ex.enText: The recent popular uprising was led by a peasant's son.

synonyms.bx: 指某一地区或国家的人为推翻政府、政权等而进行的武装暴动。

tr: a conflict in which one faction tries to wrest control from another

example: The people revolted when bread prices tripled again

value.def: A revolt is an illegal and often violent attempt by a group of people to change their country's political system.

example.ex: It was undeniably a revolt by ordinary people against their leaders...
example.tran: 不可否认，这是一场平民百姓反抗领导人的起义。

example.ex: The newly-occupied Italian colony of Libya rose in revolt in 1914.
example.tran: 意大利新占领的殖民地利比亚于1914年发生叛乱。

value.def: When people revolt, they make an illegal and often violent attempt to change their country's political system.

example.ex: Zanzibar's fortunes declined after the islanders revolted against the sultanate in 1964.
example.tran: 桑给巴尔岛的居民于1964年反抗苏丹统治，随后时局便不断恶化。

value.def: A revolt by a person or group against someone or something is a refusal to accept the authority of that person or thing.

example.ex: The prime minister is facing a revolt by party activists over his refusal to hold a referendum...
example.tran: 因为拒绝进行公民投票，首相正面临着党内激进分子的反抗。

example.ex: Soon the entire armed forces were in open revolt.
example.tran: 很快，整个武装部队开始公然抗命。

value.def: When people revolt against someone or something, they reject the authority of that person or reject that thing.

example.ex: The prime minister only reacted when three of his senior cabinet colleagues revolted and resigned in protest on Friday night...
example.tran: 直到周五晚上首相的3位高级内阁同僚倒戈并辞职以示抗议时，首相才有所反应。

example.ex: Caroline revolted against her ballet training at sixteen.
example.tran: 卡罗琳16岁时拒绝接受芭蕾舞训练。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to roll, to turn 卷, 转
rootsaffixes.title: vol, volu, volv, volt

partsOfSpeech.dec: archi〔= arch 弧形〕+ volt 卷，转 → 转成弧形 → 拱门装饰
con 共同 + volv 卷，转 + e → 共同转 → 缠绕
e 出 + volu 卷，转 + tion 表名词 → 进化
evolution 进化 + ism 学术 → 进化论
e 出 + volv 卷，转 + e → 转出来 → 进化
inter 在…之间 + volv 卷，转 + e → 在两者之间转 → 缠绕
in 进入 + volv 卷，转 + e → 转进去 → 卷入
re 相反 + volt 转 → 反转 → 叛变
re 相反 + volu 卷，转 + tion 表名词 → 革命
re 一再 + volv 卷，转 + e → 一再转 → 旋转
re 重新 + volv 卷，转 + er 表物 → 旋转连发 → 左轮手枪
volu 卷，转 + ble → 不断流转的 → 话语不断的
vol 卷，转 + ume → 装订成卷 → 卷，册
re 回；向后 + bound 跳跃 → 回弹
re 回；向后 + call 想起 → 回忆
re 回；向后 + claim 要求 → 要求拿回 → 取回
re 回；向后 + flect 弯曲 →〔光线〕向回弯曲 → 反射
re 回；向后 + gress 走 → 倒退
re 回；向后 + juven 年轻 + ate 做，造成，使… → 回到年轻状态 → 返老还童
re 回；向后 + pel 推 → 驱除；击退
re 回；向后 + son 声音 + ant …的 → 回声的 → 回响的
re 回；向后 + tract 拉 → 拉回 → 缩回
re 回；向后 + turn 转动 → 向后转 → 返回
re 相反；反对；不 + action 行动 → 反动；反应
re 相反；反对；不 + bel 战斗 → 反过来打〔自己人〕→ 反叛
re 相反；反对；不 + move 移动 → 往反方向移动 → 移开
re 相反；反对；不 + neg 否认 + ade 表人 → 反过来否认〔自己人〕的人 → 叛徒
re 相反；反对；不 + peal 呼吁 → 不呼吁 → 取消
re 相反；反对；不 + prob 正直 + ate 表人 → 不正直的人 → 堕落者
re 相反；反对；不 + sent 感觉 → 反感 → 不满
re 相反；反对；不 + sist 站 → 反抗，抵抗
re 相反；反对；不 + vers 转 + e → 反转的，颠倒的
re 相反；反对；不 + volt 转 → 反转过来〔对抗自己人〕→ 反叛
re 一再，重新 + appear 出现 → 再出现
re 一再，重新 + arrange 安排 → 重新安排
re 一再，重新 + assure 放心 → 一再让人放心 → 消除（某人）疑虑
re 一再，重新 + birth 出生 → 再生，新生
re 一再，重新 + commend 赞扬 → 一再赞扬 → 推荐
re 一再，重新 + compense 补偿 → 一再补偿 → 赔偿
re 一再，重新 + examination 考试 → 复试
re 一再，重新 + furbish 磨光，擦亮 → 再磨光
re 一再，重新 + gener 产生 + ate 使… → 重新产生〔自我〕→ 改过自新的
re 一再，重新 + number 编号码 → 重新编号
re 一再，重新 + print 出版 → 再版
re 一再，重新 + production 生产 → 再生产
re 一再，重新 + surg 升起 + ence 表行为 → 重新升起 → 复兴
